intro: Cardiochlamys madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar heartleaf, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its flowers are often pink or purple and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
